Dear Ms. McClain:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
 How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
 Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
 Specific time frames for each violation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
 How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
 The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (616) 204-6992.

Sincerely,

ALLEGATION:
There was a physical altercation between multiple youth at the facility and staff did
not step in to intervene, but they did watch the altercation take place.
INVESTIGATION:
Interviews:
Youth A was interviewed face to face at the facility on May 10, 2022, by this
consultant and again on May 13, 2022, in collaboration with MDHHS Worker.
Youth A reported on Friday May 6, 2022, she attacked Youth B with a cable cord
from the television and Staff 2 had to restrain her. She reported on May 8, 2022, she
got into a physical fight with Youth B and Youth C. Youth A reported she was upset
with Staff 2 on the morning of May 8, 2022, because she was attempting to ground
her. Youth A reported she attempted to throw a chair at Staff 2. She reported Youth
B came out of her room and started a physical fight with Youth A. During this time,
Youth A reported Staff 2 was attempting to restrain Youth A to stop the fight. Youth
A reported Staff 2 hit Youth A with a closed fist on the side of her head. She reported
Youth C then joined the fight. Staff 2 released Youth A and watched the fight occur.
Youth A reported Staff 1 was just standing in the staff office when the fight was
happening. Youth A reported the fight ended because Youth A gave up and went to
her room. She reported the fight did not end because of staff intervening. Youth A
stated a staff member from another unit came to check on the youth after the fight
was over. She reported the fight lasted about 10 minutes. Youth A reported she did
see a nurse after the fight. It should be noted, Youth A had bruising on her arms and
face. She reported the bruises were from the fight. When asked if Staff 1 and/or Staff
2 said anything to the youth during the fight, Youth A reported the staff did not say
anything. When asked if Staff 1 and/or Staff 2 has ever swore, threatened, or said
anything inappropriate to Youth A, she reported staff has never done that to her.
Youth A reported she feels safe at the facility.
Youth B was interviewed face to face at the facility on May 10, 2022, by this
consultant and again on May 13, 2022, in collaboration with MDHHS Worker.
Youth B reported on May 6, 2022, Youth A attacked her with a cord from the
television. She reported Youth A was upset with her because she wanted to date
her, and Youth B did not want to date her. Youth B reported she talked with Staff 2 in
private about the concerns of Youth A wanting to date her and that she did not feel
comfortable around Youth A due to all her accusations. She reported over the
weekend Youth A tried to apologize to the group about her recent behaviors and
Youth C made a comment that she was not accepting that apology because Youth A
continues to act out. Youth B reported on May 8, 2022, she was in her room and
heard Youth D ask Staff 2 if she was okay. Youth B reported she asked to use the
restroom so that she could see what was going on. She reported she saw Youth A
3

try to throw a chair at Staff 2 and this made Youth B upset. Youth B explained she
has a close relationship with Staff 2 and calls her “mom”. She reported Staff 1 and
Staff 2 were trying to verbally de-escalate Youth A and told her to make better
choices. Youth B reported she grabbed Youth A’s hair because she was frustrated
with Youth A’s actions. Youth B reported she started to physically fight Youth A. She
reported Staff 2 tried to restrain Youth A and Staff 1 was trying to pull Youth B off
Youth A. Youth B reported Youth C then joined the fight and started to hit Youth A.
She reported Staff 2 continued to try to get the youth apart from one another and
Staff 1 was calling for support. Youth B reported Youth A eventually went to her
room and that was how the fight ended. She reported Staff 1 and Staff 2 tried to do
all they could do to separate the youth. Youth B reported no staff hit anyone in the
fight and they were doing their job right. Youth B reported Youth A was the one to hit
Staff 2. She reported the fight lasted about 10-15 minutes. It should be noted, Youth
B had healing bruise marks on her face, arms, and legs and she reported that was
from the fight. Youth B reported she met with nursing after the fight but didn’t want to
go to the hospital because she did not want to create more paperwork for Staff 1 and
Staff 2. Youth B noted extra staff came to the unit after the fight to check on
everyone. Youth B said she did not hear Staff 1 or Staff 2 swear, threaten, or make
inappropriate comments. She reported she would feel safer at Wedgwood if Youth A
was to leave. Youth B reported Youth A is trying to follow the actions of another
youth that use to be at the facility and everyone on the unit is tired of her actions.
Youth C was interviewed face to face at the facility on May 10, 2022, by this
consultant and again on May 13, 2022, in collaboration with MDHHS Worker.
Youth C reported she was involved in the fight that occurred on May 8, 2022. She
reported she was tired of Youth A’s actions and did not like her trying to disrespect
staff members. Youth C reported when she saw Youth A and Youth B were
physically fighting, she chose to jump in to help Youth B. She reported when she
jumped in, Staff 2 was on the ground with Youth A and Youth B because Youth A
was choking Youth B. Youth C reported once she entered the fight, Staff 2 got up
and went into the office with Staff 1. She reported Staff 1 was trying to call for
support. Youth C reported staff did not do anything to end the fight and the fight
ended because Youth A got up to go to go to her room. Once the fight was over, a
couple of staff from other units came to check in on the unit but everything was over.
It should be noted, Youth C had a scratch under her eye on her face and she
reported that was from the fight. She reported she was able to meet with nursing
after the fight occurred. Youth C reported she gets frustrated with staff because they
are not consistent with the unit rules. She reported some staff like to allow youth to
do things that goes against the rules. Youth C reported Staff 2 allows the youth to do
whatever they want.
Youth D was interviewed face to face at the facility on May 10, 2022, by this
consultant and again on May 13, 2022, in collaboration with MDHHS Worker.
Youth D reported on May 8, 2022, she heard Youth A threatening to hurt Staff 2 with
a chair. Youth D said she yelled in her room to make sure that Staff 2 was okay. She
reported she saw Youth B run to the milieu and attack Youth A and moments later
4

Youth C joined in. Youth D reported Staff 2 attempted to restrain Youth A and Staff 1
attempted to get Youth B off Youth A. She reported Staff 1 also attempted to call for
more support to the unit. Youth D reported she heard that Staff 2 grabbed Youth A’s
hair during the fight. She reported the fight ended because Youth A went to her
room. Youth D reported she heard Staff 2 make the comment about how if Youth A
was going to beat her up, she would beat her right back and wouldn’t care if she lost
her job. After the fight was over, Youth D reported Staff 2 tried to tell the other youth
on the unit what to say about what happened in the fight and that Staff 2 did not pull
Youth A’s hair. Youth D reported when Staff 2 was telling the other youth this, Staff 1
was just listening to her talk. Youth D reported she heard Staff 2 make a comment in
the kitchen area saying she restrained Youth A so Youth B and Youth C could fight
her. Youth D reported she feels Staff 2 did not do her job right. She reported when
fights like this occur on the unit, other staff jump in right away to end the fight and
not just let the fight continue.
Staff 1 was interviewed face to face at the facility on May 10, 2022, by this
consultant and again on May 13, 2022, in collaboration with MDHHS Worker.
Staff 1 reported when she got to work on May 8, 2022, she prepped the morning
medication for the youth and got meals ready for the day. She reported Youth A
wanted to come out of her room and Staff 2 reported it was not time yet. Youth A
then came out of her room and she was threatening to AWOL. Staff 1 reported
Youth A picked up a chair to throw at staff and Staff 1 said she told Youth A that she
should not throw the chair. Youth A then reported she was just going to throw the
chair at Staff 2. Staff 1 reported Staff 2 made the comment that “she was on her
period and was not going to fucking deal with this today”. Staff 1 reported Staff 2
then proceeded to put her hair up in a ponytail. Staff 1 reported Youth B came out of
her room and asked to use the restroom but instead ran up on Youth A and
assaulted her. Staff 1 reported she believed Youth B began fighting Youth A
because she wanted to protect Staff 2. She reported she tried to redirect the
situation and stated she tried to get Youth B off Youth A. Staff 1 reported Staff 2 was
in the middle of the fight of Youth A and Youth B and was not following the proper
protocol. She reported she was in the middle of the fight and was swearing at the
youth. Once Youth C joined the fight, Staff 1 reported she called over to other units
and they reported they did not have enough staff. Staff 1 reported when she called
the other units, she just asked how many staff they had working. She reported she
also texted her supervisor about the situation. Staff 1 reported she called the phone
line to the extra scheduled staff, and they reported they did not come in till 2 pm.
Staff 1 reported the situation looked as if a “street fight” was occurring. Staff 1 said
she believes Staff 2 was physically hurting Youth A while Youth B and Youth C were
also hitting Youth A. When asked to clarify how Staff 2 was hurting Youth A, Staff 1
reported Staff 2 was in on the fight and physically hit Youth A. Staff 1 reported the
fight started around 8am and lasted about 10 minutes. Staff 1 reported there was no
restraint report completed because no restraint occurred. Staff 1 reported the fight
ended because Youth A went to her room. After the fight was done, Staff 1 reported
Staff 2 made a comment to her about how they should act like nothing happened,
but Staff 1 ignored her and did the paperwork. Staff 1 reported Staff 2 made the
5

comment that Youth A got what she deserved. Staff 1 reported she was shocked
about what occurred and did not feel like she could correct Staff 2. Staff 1 reported
she told the Supervisor on May 10, 2022, that Staff 2 hit Youth A.
Staff 2 was interviewed face to face at her therapist’s office on May 17, 2022, in
collaboration with MDHHS Worker and her Therapist present, at Staff 2’s
request. Staff 2 reported she worked on both May 6, 2022, and May 8, 2022, at the
facility. She reported on May 6, 2022, Youth B had come to speak with her in private
because Youth A was making her feel uncomfortable about wanting to be in a
relationship with her. Staff 2 reported after that talk, Youth A took a cable cord and
wrapped it around Youth B’s throat. Staff 2 tried to initiate a solo restraint on Youth
A. She reported she had to lift Youth A off the ground but was able to restrain her.
Staff 2 then began to talk about the incident on the morning of May 8, 2022. She
reported she was trained that the youth should not come out of their rooms on the
weekend morning until about 9:30am. She reported the plan for the morning was to
have a team meeting with all the youth on the unit to go over house expectations.
Staff 2 reported it was brought to her attention that staff have not been consistent
with rules and people are stating she is allowing the youth to do whatever they want.
Staff 2 gave the example that she was never taught that youth could not have
blankets in the milieu area and when she allowed youth to do so Staff 3 came on the
unit telling the girls “You know damn well you can’t have blankets out here.” Staff 2
reported that none of the staff were consistent with the house rules. Staff 2 reported
Youth A ended up coming out of her room early on May 8, 2022, and she demanded
staff to let her out of the unit. Staff 2 reported she said out loud, “I am tired of this
shit,” as Youth A was threatening to throw a chair. Staff 2 reported Staff 1 made a
comment asking, “I hope you are not going to throw this chair at me” and Youth A
said no she was going to throw it at Staff 2. At that point, Youth B came out of her
room and grabbed Youth A’s hair. Staff 2 noted Youth B is very close with her and
that she has had to redirect Youth B from calling her “mom”. Staff 2 reported she
was on the floor with Youth A and Youth B and was trying to restrain Youth A. She
reported she had one of Youth A’s arm back while they were sitting, and Youth A’s
other arm was trying to choke Youth B. Staff 2 reported Staff 1 was trying to pull
Youth B away, but it was not helping. Then Youth C joined, and Staff 2 released
Youth A’s arm. Staff 1 went into the office to call for support. She reported the fight
ended because Youth A went to her room. Staff 2 reported she went to check on
Youth A in her room and she reported Youth A was scratching her arms because
she self-harms. Staff 2 reported the incident occurred between 8:50-9:00am and
lasted about 10 minutes. She reported there were no extra staff to come in to
support them and it took over 2 hours until extra support arrived. Staff 2 reported
Staff 1 completed the incident report but was locked out of the computer under her
log in so Staff 1 used Staff 2’s log in information. Staff 2 reported that she did not
write the incident report. Staff 2 reported she was never trained on how to even log
into the system let alone how to write the report. This consultant asked if there was a
restraint report completed and Staff 2 reported the technique, she used was not a
restraint because she did not have two hands on Youth A and she was just trying to
break up the fight. Staff 2 reported she had participated in restraint training
6

approximately 2 or 3 weeks ago. Staff 2 reported she never hit Youth A during the
restraint, and she did not hold back Youth A to allow Youth B or C to hit her. Staff 2
reported she did not coach the youth on what to say after the incident occurred. She
reported while she was completing paperwork with Staff 1 all the youth got together
to get their story straight because Youth C was afraid, she was going to lose her on
campus job for fighting. Staff 2 also denied that she ever said to anyone that Youth
A got what she deserved. Staff 2 reported she has never felt supported or trained by
her supervisor and things are never consistent on the unit with staff. She reported
the unit really needs to have an extra staff member working on the shift for support.
Staff 2 reported she sent an email to all the administration team and board members
of the organizations about her concerns. Staff 2’s Therapist made a comment within
the interview that Staff 2 expressed the same concerns to her within sessions.
Therapist reported after the incident that occurred on May 8, 2022, Staff 2 called her
to process about the situation. Therapist reported this is why she suggested for the
interview to occur at her office.
Supervisor was interviewed face to face at the facility on May 10, 2022, by this
consultant and again on May 13, 2022, in collaboration with MDHHS Worker.
Supervisor reported she was not the on-call supervisor when the fight occurred on
May 8, 2022. Supervisor reported she received a text message from Staff 1 at
9:50am noting Youth A attacked Youth B and Youth C. She reported she told Staff 1
to make sure to keep the youth separated on the unit. Staff 1 reported to Supervisor
she was completing an incident report and called the nurse to come check the youth.
Supervisor reported she told Staff 1 she was surprised Youth B and Youth C did not
jump Youth A and Staff 1 reported they did. Supervisor reported Staff 1 never
reported any concerns about restraints being completed, lack of support, or that
Staff 2 was being inappropriate and hit Youth A. Supervisor reported later, on May 8,
2022, she received a call from Staff 3 reporting Youth A wanted to talk with her. Staff
3 reported Youth A said Staff 2 was cussing her out earlier that morning and saying,
“I don’t need this fucking job and I will beat you up.” Staff 3 also reported to
Supervisor that Youth A disclosed Staff 2 allowed Youth A to get beat up by Youth B
and Youth C and did not do anything to stop the fight. Supervisor reported Staff 3
never disclosed Youth A told her Staff 2 hit Youth A during the fight. Supervisor
reported on Monday May 9, 2022, she met with Youth A privately to talk about the
events that occurred the day prior. Youth A reported Staff 2 allowed Youth B and
Youth C to “jump” her because Youth A tried to throw a chair at Staff 2. Youth A also
reported Staff 2 was swearing at Youth A when the fight was occurring. Supervisor
reported she directly supervises Staff 1 and Staff 2. She reported Staff 2 was a
newer staff to the unit and had only been working the floor for about three weeks.
Supervisor reported Staff 2 has not obtained any official write ups but had to be
reminded about expectations and protocols that needed to be followed on the unit.
Supervisor reported Staff 2 resigned from working at Wedgwood as of Monday
March 9, 2022. She reported she has not talked with Staff 1 about the reported
concerns as she has not been on shift since Sunday March 8, 2022. Supervisor
reported both Staff 1 and Staff 2 have been trained in AGEIS restraint training and
verbal de-escalation. She reported currently the unit has 5 youth living there and
7

they have been able to maintain appropriate ratio. Supervisor reported Youth A has
been struggling lately as she is frustrated with still being in placement at Wedgwood
and has shown increased behavioral needs. She reported Youth A is making other
youth fearful on the unit with her violent actions.
Staff 3 was interviewed via telephone on May 13, 2022, in collaboration with
MDHHS worker. Staff 3 reported she worked the evening shift on the unit on May 8,
2022. Staff 3 reported Staff 1 told her Youth B and Youth C fought Youth A earlier in
the day. Staff 1 also told Staff 3 that Staff 2 was being unprofessional on shift as it
pertained to swearing in front of the youth. During the afternoon shift on May 8,
2022, Youth A asked to speak to Staff 3 in private. Youth A reported Staff 2 was
swearing at Youth A and allowed her to get beat up by Youth B and Youth C. Youth
A explained staff did nothing to stop Youth B and Youth C from assaulting her. Staff
3 reported Staff 2 put her hand on Youth A during the fight. When Staff 3 was asked
to explain more about that conversation, she reported Youth A confirmed Staff 2 hit
her during the fight. Staff 3 reported she then called her supervisor to explain what
Youth A just disclosed to her. She reported when she followed up with Youth A on
May 11, 2022, she disclosed Staff 2 was trying to restrain her during the fight.
Staff 4 was interviewed face to face at the facility on May 13, 2022, in
collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Staff 4 reported she was working on at the unit
across the hall on May 8, 2022. She reported around 9:11am she received a call
from Staff 1 asking how many staff they had working on the unit. The time was
verified via Staff 4’s cell phone log. Staff 4 reported Staff 1 never indicated that she
needed support or said anything about the fight that was occurring. Staff 4 reported
she texted her staff member that was out getting gas in the agency van to stop by
the unit across the hall to check on them. Staff 4 reported typically when there is a
crisis situation a staff member will call other units and state that they need staff
support not just ask how many staff they have working. In emergency situations a
unit will go out of ratio, if they can, to help support the unit in need.
Chief Administrator was interviewed face to face at the facility on May 10,
2022, by this consultant and again on May 13, 2022, in collaboration with
MDHHS Worker. A follow up phone call interview was completed with Chief
Administrator on May 18, 2022, in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Chief
Administrator reported she was not aware of the accusations that Staff 2 joined into
the fight that was reported. Chief Administrator reported when Staff 1 connected with
the Supervisor the only report was Youth A was assaulted by Youth B and Youth C.
There were no reports of Staff 2 being inappropriate or assaulting Youth A as well.
Chief Administrator reported she will be following up with the Supervisor and also
reminding the team about the Child Protection Law. Chief Administrator reported she
talked with other unit supervisors and found that Staff 1 only called one unit to ask
how many staff they had working and did not call the other two units to ask for
support on May 8, 2022. On May 18, 2022, the Chief Administrator confirmed there
were also no incident reports of Youth A having self-harm behavior on May 8, 2022.
8

Conference call was held with MDHHS worker on June 8, 2022. MDHHS worker
reported there is preponderance of evidence found.
Documents Reviewed:
 MiSACWIS Incident report number 135870202: Youth A was in a negative
headspace and was denied access to her room due to her safety plan. Youth A
saw Youth B come out of the office talking with Staff 2 and Youth A grabbed a
television cord. Youth A ran up behind Youth B and swung it at her, hitting her in
the neck with the cord. This then turned into a physical fight. Staff 2 was able to
restrain Youth A and Staff 1 was able to pull Youth B out. Youth B then walked to
her room and Youth A was released within seconds of the 1:1 hold.
 Wedgwood Christian Services Internal Incident Report dated May 8, 2022:
Staff 2 completed an incident report for May 8, 2022. Staff 2 reported Youth A
stated to Staff 1 and herself that they needed to open the door so Youth A could
leave. When staff told her no, Youth A picked up a chair from the milieu and
began to throw it at Staff 2. Youth B then told Youth A to leave Staff 2 alone.
Youth A began to call staff names and threw the chair. Staff 2 reported Youth A
then grabbed Youth B’s hair and they got into a physical altercation. “Staff
attempted to restrain then Youth C entered the physical altercation.” Staff called
for support.
 Nursing Note from May 8, 2022: Nurse met with Youth A, Youth B and Youth C
on Sunday May 8, 2022, around 11:50am. Note indicates bruising on all of the
youth, and they were all given Tylenol for the pain and ice. All youth denied loss
of consciousness, headache, dizziness, nausea/vomiting. Nurse met with all
youth again on Monday May 9, 2022, for a check in and all youth reported they
felt fine, and the bruises were healing.
 Policies/Procedures: Client Safety Policy (05-09) April 18, 2018. This
document indicates staff are to always keep youth safe and secure while in care.
Staff are also to adhere to this procedure and implement specific supervision
practices that are necessary.
 Text messages from Staff 1 to Supervisor dated May 8, 2022 at 9:49 am:
Staff 1 reported Youth A attacked Youth B and Youth C. She noted she is
completing an incident report and called the nurse and noted nursing was not
going to be able to see them until May 9. 2022. Staff 1 also reported there was
no extra staff assistance until 2 pm. Supervisor responded with “Okay if possible,
it would be best to have all the kids off the unit as much as possible away from
her (Youth A). I’m surprised they (Youth B and Youth C) didn’t jump her.” Staff 1
responded: “They (Youth B and Youth C) did honestly. That’s why she (Youth A)
ain’t coming out now (her room). She just yelling calling us niggers.” Supervisor
response:” Well I guess that’s what she (Youth A) gets, natural consequences.
Well I’m sure she is going get beat up again then for that.”
 Human Resource File for Staff 1: Staff 1 has been employed with the facility
since the end of August 2021. She had a disciplinary action noted on 03/24/2022
due to not attending the Intro to Crisis Prevention/ Intervention De-Escalation
training within 60 days of her hire. She was supposed to attend on 09/23/21 and
9

did not complete the training until 03/31/2022. Staff 1 is up to date on all other
required trainings.
 Human Resources file for Staff 2: There is no disciplinary action, and she is up
to date on the required trainings. Staff 2’s last day of employment was May 9,
2022.
 Email from Staff 2 to the Board Members of Wedgwood dating 05/11/2022:
Staff 2 expressed concerns that staff are not following the policies of the program
and are allowing youth to go off campus when they are on AWOL risk. She noted
during the fight that occurred on May 8, only two staff were scheduled on the unit
and extra staff were called and no one came for two hours. Staff 2 also noted
they called nursing to come check the youth and a nurse did not come for several
hours. She noted this is not a healthy work environment and has not been given
proper training. Staff 2 also noted staff on the unit would openly talk about other
staff to clients and talk negatively about other youth as well.
10

APPLICABLE RULE
R 400.4112 Criminal history check, subject to requirements; staff
qualifications.
(4) A person with ongoing duties shall have both of the
following:
(a) Ability to perform duties of the position assigned.
ANALYSIS: The facility is found in non-compliance as staff were not able to
perform their assigned duties. Throughout the interviews there
were reported concerns of Staff 2 using inappropriate language
around the youth, Staff 2 hitting Youth A, and Staff 2 allowing
Youth A to get assaulted by Youth B and C. Staff 2 reported she
attempted a restraint, and she observed Youth A self-harming,
yet she failed to complete an incident report.
There are concerns Staff 1 did not redirect Staff 2’s behavior or
report concerning behavior of Staff 2 to Supervisor. Staff 1 did
not make efforts to obtain additional support on the unit as she
only called one of the other units in the building asking what
their staffing was like not explaining the situation and need for
support.
Additionally, the text messages reviewed by Supervisor,
Supervisor made inappropriate comments and did not address a
need to provide safety for the youth.
Technical Assistance:
It was recommended during weekends and second shift an
extra staff member be provided on the unit due to the fighting
that continues to occur with the youth to provide for the safety of
all youth. Management needs to provide directive to staff what
to do if they have a concern regarding the way other staff are
doing their job or interacting with youth.
CONCLUSION: REPEAT VIOLATION ESTABLISHED

ALLEGATION:
Staff did not report Youth A being assaulted by a staff member.
INVESTIGATION:
Interviews:
Staff 1 was interviewed face to face at the facility on May 10, 2022, by this
consultant and again on May 13, 2022, in collaboration with MDHHS Worker.
On May 10, 2022, Staff 1 reported to this consultant that Staff 2 physically assaulted
Youth A during a fight that occurred on May 8, 2022. Staff 1 reported she did not tell
her supervisor until May 10, 2022, that Staff 2 hurt Youth A during the fight. When
asked why she did not immediately report that Staff 2 joined in on the fight and hit
Youth A, she reported Youth A hit Staff 1 first. She reported she is just tired of Youth
A's behaviors and does not want to be left alone with Youth A. Staff 1 reported she
told Staff 3 when she came on shift about the incident. Staff 1 was asked if she has
ever completed mandated reporting training, she reported she has not completed it
at this residential facility but has completed it at other residential facilities she
worked at. Staff 1 reported she was not aware that she would have needed to call in
the concerns about Staff 2 hitting Youth A.
Staff 3 was interviewed via telephone on May 13, 2022, in collaboration with
MDHHS worker. Staff 3 reported on May 8, 2022, Youth A disclosed to her staff
allowed Youth B and Youth C to assault her during a fight. Youth A explained staff
did nothing to stop Youth B and Youth C from assaulting her. Staff 3 reported Staff 2
put her hand on Youth A during the fight. When Staff 3 was asked to explain more
about that conversation, she reported Youth A confirmed Staff 2 hit her during the
fight. Staff 3 reported she then called her supervisor to explain what Youth A just
disclosed to her. Staff 3 was asked if she has been in trained in mandated reporting
protocol and she reported that she has completed online classes. Staff 3 reported
she told Supervisor what Youth A disclosed. She reported when she followed up
with Youth A on May 11, 2022, she disclosed Staff 2 was trying to restrain her during
the fight.
Supervisor was interviewed face to face at the facility on May 10, 2022, by this
consultant and again on May 13, 2022, in collaboration with MDHHS Worker.
Supervisor reported she spoke with both Staff 1 and Staff 3 on May 8, 2022, and
neither staff reported concerns of Staff 2 hitting Youth A during the fight.
Staff 4 was interviewed face to face at the facility on May 13, 2022, in
collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Staff 4 was asked what she would do if she
saw another staff member hitting a youth at the facility or swearing at the youth. Staff
4 reported they would help end that situation and then would call her supervisor and
make a report to Child Protective Services. Staff 4 reported they receive mandated
reported training from the facility about every 6 months.

R 400.4131 Compliance with child protection law; development of plan

ANALYSIS: The facility is found in noncompliance as Staff 1 and Staff 3 did

concerns of Youth A being physically hit by Staff 2 and there
